hanzi-su-wiki:
熱

Значения

Тепло, жар, страсть, увлечение; горячий, увлечённый

Мнемоника

Сжечь старую траву и сразу же перекопать поле вместе с углями 灬. Земля при этом ещё горячая. Вверху — делить 八 почву 土 на слои. Справа — рука с палкой 丸 в значении «разбивать комки».

Варианты

热
purpleculture_pinyin:
rè
to warm up; to heat up; hot (of weather); heat; fervent
согревать; нагреть; жарко (погоды); высокая температура; пылкий
rtega_mnemonic:
熱熱RS
热热		heat, fever, zeal, hot heated
  • pottery 埶 being fired 灬 in a kiln
  • ⓢ hand 扌 holding round 丸 objects which are put into the fire 灬
 暑
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 热)
Antonyms: 冷
Pictophonetic: 埶 indicates the sound; 灬 (fire) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
熱情 [ rè qíng ]: cordial; enthusiastic; passion; passionate; passionately
熱烈 [ rè liè ]: enthusiastic; ardent; warm
熱愛 [ rè ài ]: to love ardently; to adore
熱點 [ rè diǎn ]: hot spot; point of special interest
熱線 [ rè xiàn ]: hotline (communications link)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 埶 [ yì ] art
    • 灬 [ huǒ ] fire
heisig_chinese_memo: The rice seedlings gather in a circle on the soil around an oven fire to take more power pills. They need to heat up and power up prior to their journey.
heisig_constituent: heat, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, fat man, musashimaru, round, nine, baseball, drop, oven-fire, barbecue, soil2, dirt2, ground2
heisig_story: Rice seedlings . . . ground . . . fat man . . . oven fire.
koohiiStory1: Heat up those RICE SEEDLINGS you pulled from the SOIL in a ROUND pan over a low FLAME. (Note: the hot pan image helps reinforce the idea that this kanji for "atsui" refers to something hot to the touch, as opposed to hot weather).
koohiiStory2: Just a comment on Erikkusan's story: Although one of the pronunciations of this kanji is "atsui" this isn't the atsui that you feel in Tokyo in August, (which is Frame 1260's "sultry' 暑). This atsui is the one when you touch something hot, like a fry pan. Another reading of this is "netsu," which is the "fever" this fat man may feel after planting the rice seedlings.
jp_example_words:
光熱費(こうねつひ): cost of fuel and light
情熱(じょうねつ): passion, enthusiasm, zeal
熱意(ねつい): zeal, enthusiasm
熱湯(ねっとう): boiling water
熱量(ねつりょう): temperature
加熱(かねつ): heating
熱する(ねっする): to heat
熱帯(ねったい): tropics
熱中(ねっちゅう): enthusiasm, zeal, mania
熱(ねつ): heat, fever
熱心(ねっしん): eagerness
熱い(あつい): hot (thing)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Your womb spins in a circle and starts to boil with heat. Uh oh, I think you have a fever.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Even if you don't have a womb, just picture one anyway: it's turning around in a circle faster and faster, as the heat bubbles and boils in you. You can feel this heat spread through your entire body as you burn up with a fever.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The heat from your fever is making your insides and your head and your entire body spin and boil, until your doctor throws some nets (ねつ) around you. You were flailing around and they couldn't get you to stop, so they had to catch you in a series of nets.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: These nets aren't making the fever heat go away, but they have made the spinning stop at least.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 熟 (うれる、ジュク зрелость).
Ru_Radicals: 丶 (капля), 儿 (ножки), 九 (девять), 土 (земля), 杰
Ru_trainchinese:
rè: (прил/глаг/сущ) горячий, жаркий; популярный; подогревать; теплота; жар, горячка
rè: (графема) пылкий, сердечный; увлечение, помешательство; (о сцене) шумный, суетливый; термальный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if the fire (灬) gets round the ground ahead (埶) it would be hot
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The heat from the cooking fire made my hands clench when it got a bit too strong.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " fire " to the sound of "埶". The original meaning is high temperature. "Said Wen": "Hot, warm. From the fire, the sound of sing." Such as "Mencius. The Second King of Liang Hui: "If the water deepens, like the fire heats, it's just for luck." "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Meng Qiuji": "In the summer, there will be more fires, hot and cold, and malaria." It also refers to objects with high temperature. Such as "Poetry. Daya. "Sang Rou": "Who can hold on to heat will not die." Zheng Xuanjian: "It should be like holding a hot object with a hand."

" Heat " as a verb means to make it hot. Such as "Zhuangzi. "Qiwu Lun": "Daze burns and cannot be hot, and Hehan qi cannot be cold." It also means burning. Such as "Zhuangzi. "Autumn Water": "The most virtuous, fire can be hot, water can drown, cold and heat can be harmful, and beasts can be thief."

" Heat " is a term in traditional Chinese medicine, which means fever and heat evil. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The First Year of Zhao Gong": "Yin Yin and cold disease, Yang Yin and heat disease." "Mawangdui Silk Book. "Fifty-two prescriptions", line 50: "The idle (epilepsy) person is shocked by the heat, and the neck spine is strong and the abdomen is large."

" Hot " is a metaphor for anxiety and emotion. Such as "Mencius. "Wan Zhang Shang": "Shi, you admire the king, if you don't want to be the ruler, you will be enthusiastic." Zhao Qi's note: "A passion, a passion for fear." The Biography of Du Luan, Liu, Li, and Liu Xie: "Stealing the world before encountering Zhang Jiao's rebellion, and then being attacked by Bian Zhang, every time I hear the sound of Yushu's emergency, my heart burns and my body is scared."

" Hot " means noisy and lively. For example, Yang Wanli of the Southern Song Dynasty "Searching for Plums on a Snowy Night": "If you want to snow before you have snow, plum blossoms are not used to the heat of the world." Feng Menglong of the Ming Dynasty, "Awakening the World and Hengyan." "Qian Xiucai Wrongly Occupied the Phoenix Stars": "There are variegated colors on the bow of the ship, and the drums are vigorous, and it is so exciting."

" Hot " means powerful and prominent. Such as "Book of Jin. "The Legend of Hermit": "No virtue but no respect, no power but heat, and entering Zidian after arranging the golden gate." Bai Juyi of the Tang Dynasty "Twenty assistant professors at the beginning of Zanshan": "Lonely Cao Sifei is hot, depression and snow are cold. ."

" Hot " expresses envy. For example, Han Yu of the Tang Dynasty (Twenty-Six Lizhi to Cui Cui): "The generations are jealous and hot, panting like a bamboo tube." Chapter 46 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "My eyes were hot, and I was sent to the fire pit. "
humanum_short_description_en: From the " fire ", " shame " sound. The original meaning is high temperature.
humanum_full_description:
從「火」，「埶」聲。本義是溫度高。《說文》：「熱，溫也。从火，埶聲。」如《孟子．梁惠王下》：「如水益深，如火益熱，亦運而已矣。」《呂氏春秋．孟秋紀》：「行夏令，則多火災，寒熱不節，民多瘧疾。」又指溫度高的物件。如《詩．大雅．桑柔》：「誰能執熱，逝不以濯。」鄭玄箋：「當如手執熱物之用濯。」

　　「熱」作動詞表示使之熱。如《莊子．齊物論》：「大澤焚而不能熱，河漢沍而不能寒。」又表示燃燒。如《莊子．秋水》：「至德者，火弗能熱，水弗能溺，寒暑弗能害，禽獸弗能賊。」

　　「熱」是中醫名詞，表示熱症、熱邪。如《左傳．昭公元年》：「陰淫寒疾，陽淫熱疾。」《馬王堆帛書．五十二病方》第50行：「閒（癇）者身熱而數驚，頸脊強而復（腹）大。」

　　「熱」比喻著急、情緒激動。如《孟子．萬章上》：「仕則慕君，不得於君則熱中。」趙岐注：「熱中，心熱恐懼也。」《後漢書．杜欒劉李劉謝列傳》：「竊見天下前遇張角之亂，後遭邊章之寇，每聞羽書告急之聲，心灼內熱，四體驚竦。」

　　「熱」表示喧鬧、熱鬧。如南宋楊萬里〈雪夜尋梅〉：「臘前欲雪竟未雪，梅花不慣人間熱。」明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．錢秀才錯占鳳凰儔》：「船頭俱掛了雜綵，鼓樂振天，好生鬧熱。」

　　「熱」表示有權勢、顯赫。如《晉書．隱逸傳》：「無德而尊，無勢而熱，排金門而入紫闥。」唐代白居易〈初授贊善大夫早朝寄李二十助教〉：「寂寞曹司非熱地，蕭條風雪是寒天。」

　　「熱」表示羨慕。如唐代韓愈〈寄崔二十六立之〉：「儕輩妒且熱，喘如竹筒吹。」《紅樓夢》第46回：「看的眼熱了，也把我送在火坑裡去。」
humanum_short_description: 從「火」，「埶」聲。本義是溫度高。

Total strokes: 15; Radical: 火
Pictophonetic: 埶 indicates the sound; 灬 (fire) conveys the meaning.

熱愛 [ rè ài ]: to love ardently; to adore
熱點 [ rè diǎn ]: hot spot; point of special interest
熱線 [ rè xiàn ]: hotline (communications link)

re4
HSK 1: 熱,热
熱熱RS
热热 		heat, fever, zeal, hot heated
  • pottery 埶 being fired 灬 in a kiln
  • ⓢ hand 扌 holding round 丸 objects which are put into the fire 灬
 暑
(Simplified: 热)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 冷
Pictophonetic: 埶 indicates the sound; 灬 (fire) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 埶 [ yì ] art
    • 灬 [ huǒ ] fire
①溫度高，感覺溫度高，與“冷”相對：熱水。熱帶。灼熱。熱度。水深火熱(喻人民生活處境異常艱難痛苦)。
②身體發燒：熱症。
③使溫度升高：熱敷。
④情意深：熱心。熱情。熱忱。熱切。熱血。熱愛。
⑤旺、盛：熱鬧。熱潮。熱火朝天。
⑥形容非常羨慕或急切想得到：熱中。
⑦受很多人普遍歡迎、關注的：熱銷。熱門兒。
⑧物理學上指物體內部分子不規則運動發出的一種能：熱能。熱力學(研究熱能和別種能相互轉化的科學)。
⑨放射性強：熱核武器。
熱情 [ rè qíng ]: cordial; enthusiastic; passion; passionate; passionately
熱烈 [ rè liè ]: enthusiastic; ardent; warm
熱愛 [ rè ài ]: to love ardently; to adore
熱點 [ rè diǎn ]: hot spot; point of special interest
熱線 [ rè xiàn ]: hotline (communications link)

從「 火 」，「 埶 」聲。本義是溫度高。《說文》：「熱，溫也。从火，埶聲。」如《孟子．梁惠王下》：「如水益深，如火益熱，亦運而已矣。」《呂氏春秋．孟秋紀》：「行夏令，則多火災，寒熱不節，民多瘧疾。」又指溫度高的物件。如《詩．大雅．桑柔》：「誰能執熱，逝不以濯。」鄭玄箋：「當如手執熱物之用濯。」 「 熱 」作動詞表示使之熱。如《莊子．齊物論》：「大澤焚而不能熱，河漢沍而不能寒。」又表示燃燒。如《莊子．秋水》：「至德者，火弗能熱，水弗能溺，寒暑弗能害，禽獸弗能賊。」 「 熱 」是中醫名詞，表示熱症、熱邪。如《左傳．昭公元年》：「陰淫寒疾，陽淫熱疾。」《馬王堆帛書．五十二病方》第50行：「閒（癇）者身熱而數驚，頸脊強而復（腹）大。」 「 熱 」比喻著急、情緒激動。如《孟子．萬章上》：「仕則慕君，不得於君則熱中。」趙岐注：「熱中，心熱恐懼也。」《後漢書．杜欒劉李劉謝列傳》：「竊見天下前遇張角之亂，後遭邊章之寇，每聞羽書告急之聲，心灼內熱，四體驚竦。」 「 熱 」表示喧鬧、熱鬧。如南宋楊萬里〈雪夜尋梅〉：「臘前欲雪竟未雪，梅花不慣人間熱。」明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．錢秀才錯占鳳凰儔》：「船頭俱掛了雜綵，鼓樂振天，好生鬧熱。」 「 熱 」表示有權勢、顯赫。如《晉書．隱逸傳》：「無德而尊，無勢而熱，排金門而入紫闥。」唐代白居易〈初授贊善大夫早朝寄李二十助教〉：「寂寞曹司非熱地，蕭條風雪是寒天。」 「 熱 」表示羨慕。如唐代韓愈〈寄崔二十六立之〉：「儕輩妒且熱，喘如竹筒吹。」《紅樓夢》第46回：「看的眼熱了，也把我送在火坑裡去。」

熱字的基本解释

熱
rè
见“热”。

熱字的汉语字典释义

[①]［rè］
［《廣韻》如列切，入薛，日。］
“热1”的繁体字。
(1)温度高。与“冷”相对。
(2)指暑气；暑天。
(3)加热；使之热。
(4)烧；烧灼。
(5)焦躁；忧灼。
(6)指使焦灼。
(7)激动。
(8)喻因激动而不够理智。
(9)喻有权势，显赫。
(10)形容羨慕至极。
(11)新的；吸引人的。
(12)指新兴的、吸引人的潮流。
(13)情意深厚。
(14)指男女恋爱。
(15)喧闹；热闹。
(16)喻成熟的时机。
(17)中医学名词。热邪。六气之一，为致病的因素。
(18)中医学名词。热症。古指阳气亢盛的病症。后多指身体发烧。
(19)中医学名词。治疗方法。温法或祛寒法。
(20)中医学名词。药物性能。寒热温凉四气之一。
(21)物理学名词。物质运动的一种表现。其本质是大量粒子（分子、原子等）无规则运动的表现。这种运动越剧烈，由这些粒子组成的物体或体系就越热。热量有时亦省称为热。
(22)姓。宋有热焕。见《奇姓通》。

熱字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　熱； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页681第08
【唐韻】如列切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】而列切，?音苶。【說文】溫也。【釋名】?也。如火所燒?。【增韻】炎氣。【詩·大雅】誰能執熱，逝不以濯。【禮·月令】大雨時行，燒薙行水，利以殺草，如以熱湯。　又【唐韻正】如例反。【束皙·近遊賦】繫複襦以御冬。脅汗衫以當熱。帽引四角之縫。裙爲數條之殺。【餅賦】三春之初，隂陽交際，寒氣旣除，溫不至熱。　【正字通】說文本作?，十二畫。省作熱。非。

字形对比：

熱字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
heat
rè
See "hot".
heat
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［rè］
["Guang Yun" such as column cut, enter Xue, day. ]
Traditional characters for "热1".
(1) The temperature is high. Contrast with "cold".
(2) Refers to Shuqi; Shutian.
(3) Heat; make it hot.
(4) Burn; burn.
(5) Anxiety; anxiety.
(6) Indulge in anxiety.
(7) Excitement.
(8) Yu is not rational enough due to excitement.
(9) Yu is powerful and prominent.
(10) Describe extremely envious.
(11) New; attractive.
(12) Refers to emerging and attractive trends.
(13) Deep affection.
(14) Refers to the love of men and women.
(15) Noisy; lively.
(16) Yu's time for maturity.
(17) Chinese medical terms. Hot evil. One of the six qi is a disease-causing factor.
(18) Chinese medical terms. Fever. In ancient times, it refers to the symptoms of hyper-yang qi. Afterwards, the body has a fever.
(19) Chinese medical terms. treatment method. Warming method or dispelling cold method.
(20) Chinese medical terms. Drug properties. One of the four qi of cold, heat, warm and cool.
(21) Physics terms. A manifestation of material movement. Its essence is the performance of the irregular movement of a large number of particles (molecules, atoms, etc.). The more violent this movement, the hotter the object or system composed of these particles. Heat is sometimes referred to as heat.
(22) Last name. Song Yourehuan. See "Qi Xing Tong".

Old glyph
heat
Name meaning
Nothing.
rè
вм. 热
Radicals: 坴, 丸, 灬  (womb, circle, boil)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your womb spins in a circle and starts to boil with heat. Uh oh, I think you have a fever.
Even if you don't have a womb, just picture one anyway: it's turning around in a circle faster and faster, as the heat bubbles and boils in you. You can feel this heat spread through your entire body as you burn up with a fever.
Reading Mnemonic
The heat from your fever is making your insides and your head and your entire body spin and boil, until your doctor throws some nets (ねつ) around you. You were flailing around and they couldn't get you to stop, so they had to catch you in a series of nets.
These nets aren't making the fever heat go away, but they have made the spinning stop at least.
